title: Trump-Colombia tensions thaw after months of heated exchanges
subhead: After threatening and insulting Colombian leader Gustavo Petro, the US president unexpectedly invited him to the White House.

US strengthens grip on Venezuela by seizing two oil tankers, including one flying the Russian flag
subhead: The US Coast Guard pursued the ship, which had placed itself under Russian protection, as far as the waters off Iceland. Washington said it belonged to the 'ghost fleet' transporting oil under sanctions.

title: Syria: New clashes between government forces and Kurds signal failure of negotiations
subhead: The latest outbreak of violence highlights the deadlock in talks over the integration of the Kurdish-majority Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) into the new Syrian state.

title: Eating too many preservatives could increase cancer and diabetes risks
subhead: Two epidemiological studies suggest a link between certain chronic diseases and high exposure to preservative additives. These initial findings need to be confirmed by further research.

title: China's Pingtan Island reflects rising tensions in the Taiwan Strait
subhead: On Pingtan Island, China's closest point to Taiwan, repeated Chinese military maneuvers are exasperating fishers and fueling 'reunification' tourism.

Venezuela: How the US spent months preparing the military operation to capture Maduro
subhead: Images verified by Le Monde made it possible to reconstruct the US's vast military deployment at sea, on land and in the air in the months leading up to the abduction of the Venezuelan president.

title: 'They tried to erase our history': Sudan's national heritage is threatened by war
subhead: 'War in Sudan: A Trapped Nation' (5/6)  When the country's museum collections fell into the Rapid Support Forces' hands, they became a real weapon in the conflict with the regular army. Some say the aim is to erase and replace Sudanese identity.

title: Maduro, the failed heir to Hugo Chavez's Bolivarian Revolution
subhead: The Venezuelan president, recently abducted by the US, was chosen by Hugo Chavez as his successor and narrowly elected in 2013. Over 13 years in power, he has eliminated political opposition, tightened control over state institutions and overseen a 70% collapse in GDP as a quarter of Venezuelans fled the country.
